event.name: ShipmentDelivered
event.summary: Event represents when a shipment has been delievered and received.

producers.name: Shipping Service
producers.summary: Event based application that handles processing of shipments, preparing them and dispatching them.

publishes.name: ShipmentDelivered
publishes.summary: Event represents when a shipment has been delievered and received.

publishes.name: ShipmentDispatched
publishes.summary: Event represents when a shipment has been dispatched.

publishes.name: ShipmentPrepared
publishes.summary: Event represents when a shipment has finished being prepared and is ready to be dispatched.

subscribes.name: OrderConfirmed
subscribes.summary: Event represents when an order has been confirmed and ready to be processed (shipped for example)

subscribes.name: ShipmentDispatched
subscribes.summary: Event represents when a shipment has been dispatched.

subscribes.name: ShipmentPrepared
subscribes.summary: Event represents when a shipment has finished being prepared and is ready to be dispatched.

consumers.name: Data Lake
consumers.summary: Our internal datalake used by the data team and business analytics.

subscribes.name: AddedItemToCart
subscribes.summary: Holds information about what the user added to their shopping cart.

subscribes.name: OrderComplete
subscribes.summary: Event represents when an order has been complete. (Delivered and finished)

subscribes.name: RemovedItemFromCart
subscribes.summary: Holds information about what the user removed from their cart.

subscribes.name: ShipmentDelivered
subscribes.summary: Event represents when a shipment has been delievered and received.

markdown.content:
<Admonition>When firing this event make sure you set the `correlation-id` in the headers. Our schemas have standard metadata make sure you read and follow it.</Admonition>

### Details

This event is triggered when a shipment has been delievered to it's destination.

<NodeGraph title="Consumer / Producer Diagram" />

<Schema />
